entry.title: Ronaldo scores 5 in Madrid's 9-1 rout; PSG beats Marseille
entry.summary: Barcelona had to work much harder at Celta Vigo, but Jeremy Mathieu scored in the 73rd minute " his second goal in as many games " to maintained the club's four-point lead over Madrid.

entry.title: Ronaldo scores 5 in Madrid's 9-1 rout of Granada
entry.summary: Only Alfredo Di Stefano with 308 goals in 396 games and Raul Gonzalez with 323 in 741 have more goals in Madrid's history.

entry.title: Ronaldo scores 5 in Madrid's 9-1 rout of Granada
entry.summary: Ronaldo's 28th game with three-or-more goals for Madrid increased his career tally with the club to 300 goals in 287 games.

entry.title: Ronaldo scores 5 in Madrid's 9-1 rout of Granada
entry.summary: Madrid hadn't scored nine goals in a league match in 47 years.

entry.title: Ronaldo scores 5 in Madrid's 9-1 rout of Granada
entry.summary: Madrid and the Spanish league said this was the first time Ronaldo had scored five goals in a game and it came after a two-month stretch when the Portugal star was merely extremely good after his spectacular year in 2014.

entry.title: Ronaldo hits five as Real crush Granada 9-1
entry.summary: Champions Atletico Madrid are third on 62 points after they won 2-0 at bottom side Cordoba on Saturday.

entry.title: Ronaldo scores 5 in Madrid's 9-1 rout of Granada
entry.summary: Usually protective of his players, Madrid coach Carlo Ancelotti said on Saturday that Ronaldo "had lowered his productivity" in the past two months as Madrid lost its league lead to Barcelona.

entry.title: Ronaldo scores 5 in Madrid's 9-1 rout of Granada
Real Madrid defender Pepe sidelined by thigh injury
entry.summary: "Following medical tests carried out on Pepe by the Real Madrid doctors in the Sanitas La Moraleja Hospital, he has been diagnosed with an injury in the vastus internus muscle in his right thigh," Real said on their website.

entry.title: Real Madrid agree deal to buy Porto defender Danilo
entry.summary: He will compete for a starting place in Madrid with Daniel Carvajal and former Liverpool defender Alvaro Arbeloa.

entry.title: Real Madrid bans member for insulting players after defeat
entry.summary: Spanish media published images showin fans shouting and hitting cars leaving Madrid's training ground, which is located near the city's international airport.

entry.title: Atletico coach Simeone extends contract to 2020
entry.summary: Atletico won the Europa League at the end of his debut season and reached the final of the Champions League in 2013-14 where they lost 4-1 to Real Madrid after extra time.

entry.title: Simeone signs contract extension with Atletico Madrid
entry.summary: Atletico Madrid coach Diego Simeone arrives for a press conference at the Vicente Calderon stadium in Madrid, Spain, Tuesday, March 24, 2015.

entry.title: Real Madrid identify and ban fan after attack on Gareth Bale's Bentley following El Clasico defeat
entry.summary: Players including Wales winger Bale and forward Jese were targeted along with coach Carlo Ancelotti after they arrived back in Madrid following their 2-1 defeat at Barcelona in the La Liga 'Clasico'.

entry.title: Gareth Bale's car attacked by angry Real Madrid fans following defeat by Barcelona
Suarez's goal against Madrid marks turnaround for Barcelona
entry.summary: On Sunday, Suarez scored a superb game-winning goal in a 2-1 victory over Real Madrid.

entry.title: Suarez's goal against Madrid marks turnaround for Barcelona
entry.summary:
Barcelona has won 18 of 19 games since, and now has back-to-back wins over English champion Manchester City and European champion Madrid.

Suarez's goal on Sunday restored Barcelona's lead after Cristiano Ronaldo had equalized for Madrid.

entry.title: Suarez gives Barca win over Madrid, United beats Liverpool
entry.summary: Barcelona opened up a four-point gap over Madrid with another 10 rounds remaining to decide the league crown.

entry.title: Suarez gives Barca win over Madrid, United beats Liverpool
entry.summary: Lionel Messi curled in a perfect free kick for Jeremy Mathieu to head in Barcelona's opener in the 19th minute of a first half otherwise dominated by Madrid.

entry.title: Barcelona 2-1 Real Madrid
Protesters march against austerity measures in Madrid
entry.summary: Last year's inaugural "march for dignity" in Madrid descended into violence with dozens of protesters and police officers injured in clashes.

entry.title: Thousands gather for anti-austerity rally in Spain
entry.summary:
Plain clothes police arrest a protestor, centre bottom, after riots during a "Dignity March" to protest against the Government in Madrid, Spain, Saturday, March 21, 2015.

Protestors carry banners reading "Food, jobs and a roof with dignity. Working for a general strike" during a "Dignity March" to protest against the Government in Madrid, Spain, Saturday, March 21, 2015.

entry.title: Barcelona's Busquets may be fit for Real Madrid clash
entry.summary: Barcelona leads the league by one point over Madrid.

entry.title: Barcelona's Busquets may be fit for Real Madrid clash
entry.summary: Javier Mascherano has played in his place and would do so again against Madrid if Busquets isn't fit.

entry.title: Barcelona vs Real Madrid - El Clasico: Messi, Ronaldo, Suarez, Bale, Neymar, Benzema - how do you fit them all into a combined XI?
Real Madrid meets Atletico in Champions League quarterfinals
entry.summary: Madrid won its record 10th title in the continental competition last year with a 4-1 victory over Atletico, which has dominated their most recent match-ups.

entry.title: Real Madrid meets Atletico in Champions League quarterfinals
entry.summary:
Last month, Madrid was handed its biggest defeat in four years as it slumped to a 4-0 loss at Atletico in the Spanish capital derby.

"They're (Atletico) a side who know how to compete, they let in few goals, are good from dead balls and get the best out of each situation," said former Real Madrid player Emilio Butragueno, now a director of institutional relations at the club.

entry.title: Madrid derby highlight of ECL quarters
entry.summary: "Football doesn't have a memory. It would be a big error to think about the recent results we have had against Real Madrid," said Atletico director Clemente Villaverde.

entry.title: Madrid derby highlight of ECL quarters
Barcelona aims for decisive blow against Real Madrid
entry.summary:
"Madrid never plays poorly and when they appear to be struggling, they are even more dangerous. They have incredibly talented players, and we have to respect then more than ever."

Barcelona has reached the final of the Copa del Rey, the quarterfinals of the Champions League, and has passed Madrid in the league.

The game may well be decided in the midfield, where Madrid has finally managed to match Barcelona by bringing in strong passers like Toni Kroos and Francisco "Isco" Alarcon.

Madrid will be without James Rodriguez with a broken foot, while Javier Mascherano should seamlessly fill in for Barcelona in place of injured stopper Sergio Busquets.

With all eyes on the clasico, third-place Valencia will try to gain ground on the top two when it visits Elche on Friday trailing Madrid by seven points.

entry.title: Barcelona aims for decisive blow against Real Madrid
entry.summary:
Madrid has gone the other way.

Madrid will arrive at Camp Nou the better rested team after not having played since last Sunday.

Not surprisingly, Madrid's troubles coincide with a dip in form from Ronaldo.

Defending champion Atletico Madrid is a point behind Valencia and hosts Getafe on Saturday, while Sevilla visits Villarreal in a meeting of the league's fifth- and sixth-place sides on Sunday.

entry.title: Cervantes remains found in Madrid convent, investigators believe
entry.summary: Authorities in Madrid are hoping to build a monument within the church to commemorate the writer, with the goal of completing that work by April of next year, the 400th anniversary of his death.

entry.title: Cervantes remains found in Madrid convent, investigators believe
entry.summary:
Cervantes, often lauded as having written the first modern novel, died in 1616 after requesting burial in a convent in Madrid where, for almost a year, investigators have been searching the subsoil for bones that they now believe to include some of the author's.

Born near Madrid in 1547, Cervantes has been described as the father of the modern novel for The Ingenious Gentleman Don Quixote of La Mancha, published in two parts, in 1605 and 1615.

entry.title: Monaco and Atl?tico Madrid Advance in Champions League
entry.summary:
In Madrid, Raul Garcia opened the shootout by putting his attempt over the crossbar, and Atletico's Jan Oblak saved Hakan Calhanoglu's shot.

Real Madrid, Bayern Munich and Porto also advanced last week.

entry.title: 'Don Quixote' author's remains found in Madrid convent, investigators believe
entry.summary: MADRID - Investigators said on Tuesday they believe remains found under a Madrid convent include those of Miguel de Cervantes, the author of "Don Quixote" and considered the father of the modern novel.

entry.title: Cervantes remains found in Madrid convent, investigators believe
entry.summary: Cervantes had a sister who is buried near Madrid, but only tiny bone fragments remain of her body.

entry.title: Remains of 'Don Quixote' author Cervantes 'identified' in Madrid
entry.summary: Madrid mayor Ana Botella said on Tuesday that authorities were looking into the possibility of opening up the site to visitors.

entry.title: Cervantes remains found in Madrid convent, investigators believe
Madrid remains are those of Miguel de Cervantes, investigators believe
